idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

descript.abstract: United States Airports is a point theme representing airports in the United States, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, and U.S. Possessions with airport passenger enplanements of greater than or equal to 100 passengers per year. Attribute information includes the name, field, state, enplanements and type of airport.
descript.purpose: United States Airports provides information about the locations, names, location identifiers, and enplanements of airports for conducting geographic analysis on national and large regional scales.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:2,000,000.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Airports, 2012

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent locations where aircraft take off and land in the United States and its possessions.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The unique (3-4 character) identifier assigned to the airport.

codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Transportation, Federal Aviation Administration

attr.attrdef: The name or identification for the airport.

codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Transportation, Federal Aviation Administration

attr.attrdef: The name of the airfield associated with the airport.
The name of the state in which the airport is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code (two-digit number) for the state in which the airport is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: Indicates if the airport is listed in the Air Carrier Activity Information System (ACAIS) database. ACAIS is a database that contains revenue passenger enplanement and all-cargo data. The database supports the Federal Aviation Administration's (FAA) Airport Improvement Program (AIP) entitlement activities.
attr.attrdefs: Air Carrier Activity Information System, Federal Aviation Administration

edom.edomvd: The airport is an ACAIS Airport.
edom.edomvds: Air Carrier Activity Information System, Federal Aviation Administration

attr.attrdef: The total enplanements during calendar year 2003 (the sum of large certified, commuter, air taxi, foreign, and in-transit enplanements).
attr.attrdefs: Air Carrier Activity Information System, Federal Aviation Administration

edom.edomvd: All airports in this data set have airport passenger enplanements of greater than or equal to 100 passengers per year.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: Airports of the United States, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, 2012
citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.othercit: The data set was downloaded from the website in August 2002.

procstep.procdesc:
Data from the NATIONAL TRANSPORTATION ATLAS DATABASES 1997 (NTAD97) CD-ROM were obtained from the Department of Transportation. Using the airport.pnt and airport.t01 files on the CD-ROM, airports with passenger enplanement of greater than or equal to 250 passengers per year were selected to create a point coverage to which the following attributes were attached: airport location identifier, name of airport, name of State, State FIPS code, Air Carrier Activity Information System airports, and Total Enplanement. The data were converted to shapefile format for use in National Atlas applications and for distribution to the public.
Airports for Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands were added. Airport names were changed from all upper case and no period after initials to lower case and period after initials. For example, LYNDON B JOHNSON is now Lyndon B. Johnson.
Airports of the United States, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands 1999 was updated with enplanement data from National Transportation Atlas Databases 2001 (NTAD-2001). Existing airports, heliports, and seaplane bases with enplanements of 250 or greater were kept in the data set, while those below 250 enplanements were deleted. Sixty-five airports, heliports, and seaplane bases that had 250 or greater enplanements were added. The following attributes were added to Airports of the United States, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands 1999: Feature, indicating the type of facility, name of County, and County FIPS code.

The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded the ArcView GIS Shapefile compressed file, airprtx020.tar.gz, from the National Atlas of the United States and extracted it. Removed unneeded attributes. Changed the values of the STATE attribute from abbreviations to full names. Added attribute ACAIS and coded it from Esri Data & Maps 2002 U.S. National Atlas Airports and FAA CY1999 ACAIS data base. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.

citeinfo.title: PRIMARY AIRPORT ENPLANEMENT ACTIVITY SUMMARY FOR CY1999
North American Transportation Atlas Data
citeinfo.othercit: Downloaded the United States Public Use Airports data set.

citeinfo.title: CY 2003 Passenger Boarding and All-Cargo Data
citeinfo.othercit: Downloaded the All Primary, Non-primary, Commercial Service Airports by State data set in Excel format.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Updated the TOT_ENP attribute and populated it with 2003 Federal Aviation Administration data of greater than or equal to 100 passengers per year. Added the FIELD attribute and populated it with airfield names from the NAME attribute. Added the TYPE attribute and populated it based on the NAME attribute and North American Transportation Atlas Data.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
